DataElement.preferredName: Stage Prognostic Factors National Program of Cancer Registries Specific Field Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Field used when information for a particular primary site needs to be collected by NPCR.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Stage Prognostic Factor National Program of Cancer Registries Specified Field
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer in the body. Staging is usually based on the size of the tumor, whether lymph nodes contain cancer, and whether the cancer has spread from the original site to other parts of the body._The general personal and health characteristics that have a bearing on the course of a disease and its eventual outcome._Established by Congress through the Cancer Registries Amendment Act in 1992, and administered by CDC, the National Program of Cancer Registries (NPCR) collects data on cancer occurrence (including the type, extent, and location of the cancer), the type of initial treatment, and outcomes. It supports central cancer registries in 46 states, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, the U.S. Pacific Island Jurisdictions, and the U.S. Virgin Islands._Clearly and explicitly stated._The region in which a particular type of force can be observed, often viewed as a space which was modified by the sources of the force which the field represents.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.:The general personal and health characteristics that have a bearing on the course of a disease and its eventual outcome.

Concepts.definition: The extent of a cancer in the body.
The general personal and health characteristics that have a bearing on the course of a disease and its eventual outcome.

Property.preferredName: National Program of Cancer Registries Specified Field

It supports central cancer registries in 46 states, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, the U.S. Pacific Island Jurisdictions, and the U.S. Virgin Islands.:Clearly and explicitly stated.:The region in which a particular type of force can be observed, often viewed as a space which was modified by the sources of the force which the field represents.

Concepts.definition: Established by Congress through the Cancer Registries Amendment Act in 1992, and administered by CDC, the National Program of Cancer Registries (NPCR) collects data on cancer occurrence (including the type, extent, and location of the cancer), the type of initial treatment, and outcomes. It supports central cancer registries in 46 states, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, the U.S. Pacific Island Jurisdictions, and the U.S. Virgin Islands.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Top level term which includes Biological Markers, Risk Factors, and Prognostic Factors.
